snippet: President Obama vowed to appeal a federal judge’s decision to block his administration’s sweeping immigration plan.
abstract: Obama administration postpones indefinitely comprehensive executive actions on immigration in wake of Federal District Court Judge Andrew S Hanen's ruling in favor of 26 states challenging orders; ruling is prominent setback for Pres Obama, who vows to appeal ruling and maintains he will win in legal battle.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIA PRESTON
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Julia Preston from New York. Ashley Parker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama vowed to appeal a federal judge’s decision to block his administration’s sweeping immigration plan.

headline.main: Dealt Setback, Obama Puts Off Immigrant Plan
headline.print_headline: Dealt Setback, Obama Puts Off Immigrant Plan
